Puluhan jenazah yang ditemukan di dalam truk kontainer di Inggris berhasil diidentifikasi
07 Nov 2019, 15:47 by BBC


Jenazah ini ditemukan di truk kontainer berpendingin dini hari tanggal 23 Oktober 2019.

Polisi di Inggris telah selesai mengidentifikasi jenazah 39 orang yang ditemukan di dalam truk kontainer berpendingin di Essex, di dekat London, beberapa waktu lalu.
Kepolisian Essex bekerja sama dengan pihak berwenang Vietnam mengidentifikasi jenazah yang terdiri dari 31 pria dan delapan perempuan yang ditemukan di kawasan industrial di Grays, 23 Oktober.
Sejumlah dokumen telah diserahkan kepada koroner senior Caroline Beasley-Murray.
Kepolisian menyatakan mereka ingin memberi waktu yang cukup kepada anggota keluarga sebelum mengumumkan nama-nama itu ke publik.


Puluhan jenazah ditemukan di dalam truk kontainer di Inggris


Orang-orang Vietnam yang mempertaruhkan segalanya demi pergi ke Inggris


Polisi Belgia menemukan 12 orang masih hidup di dalam truk berpendingin


Wakil kepala polisi Tim Smith menyatakan bahwa identifikasi ini merupakan "sebuah langkah penting" dalam penyelidikan.
Jenazah-jenazah ini ditemukan di Waterglade Industrial Estate, Essex, sesudah truk kontrainer berpendingan itu melakukan perjalanan ke Purfleet dari Zeebrugge, di Belgia.
Prosedur ekstradisi
Pengemudi truk, Maurice Robinson, asal Irlandia Utara, hadir di persidangan minggu lalu dan dikenai serangkaian tuduhan kriminal, termasuk pembunuhan terhadap 39 orang.
Prosedur ekstradisi juga sedang berlangsung untuk membawa dan mengadili Eamonn Harrison, 22 tahun, yang ditangkap di Dublin berdasarkan European Arrest Warrant.
Selain itu ada 11 penangkapan lain di dua provinsi di Vietnam terkait kematian ini.


Pham Thi Tra My dan Nguyen Dinh Luong dikhawatirkan oleh anggota keluarga mereka berada di antara korban yang tewas di dalam truk.

Dozens of bodies were found in container trucks in the UK successfully identified
Nov 7 2019, 15:47 by BBC


This body was found in a refrigerated container truck in the early hours of October 23, 2019.

Police in the UK have finished identifying the bodies of 39 people found in refrigerated container trucks in Essex, near London, some time ago.
The Essex Police in collaboration with Vietnamese authorities identified the bodies of 31 men and eight women who were found in an industrial area in Grays, 23 October.
A number of documents have been submitted to senior coroner Caroline Beasley-Murray.
The police said they wanted to give family members sufficient time before announcing the names to the public.


Dozens of bodies were found in container trucks in the UK


Vietnamese people who risk everything to go to England


Belgian police found 12 people still living in refrigerated trucks


Deputy police chief Tim Smith stated that this identification was "an important step" in the investigation.
The bodies were found at the Waterglade Industrial Estate, Essex, after the refrigerated contrainer truck traveled to Purfleet from Zeebrugge, in Belgium.
Extradition procedure
The truck driver, Maurice Robinson, from Northern Ireland, was present at the trial last week and was charged with a series of criminal charges, including the killing of 39 people.
Extradition procedures are also underway to bring and try Eamonn Harrison, 22, who was arrested in Dublin under the European Arrest Warrant.
In addition there are 11 other arrests in two provinces in Vietnam related to this death.


Pham Thi Tra My and Nguyen Dinh Luong are feared by their family members to be among those killed in the truck.
